title: Culture: Food (Usefulness 1-5)
description: Traveler usefulness 1-5/10 phrases for the Food subcategory within Culture. Includes 33 card(s).

cards.english: Traditionally people in West Japan enjoy tempura with salt, whereas people in East Japan dip it in a special sauce.
cards.romaji: Nishi Nihon de wa tempura o shio de tabemasu ga, higashi Nihon de wa tentsuyu ni tsukete tabemasu.
cards.japanese: 西日本では天ぷらを塩で食べますが、東日本では天つゆにつけて食べます。

cards.english: Tempura is a Japanese dish.
cards.romaji: Tenpura wa nihon no ryori desu.
cards.japanese: 天ぷらは日本の料理です。

cards.english: Rice balls are available even at convenience stores.
cards.romaji: Onigiri wa, konbini de mo kaemasu.
cards.japanese: おにぎりは、コンビニでも買えます。

cards.english: Tofu is famous all over the world as a healthy food.
cards.romaji: T fu wa, kenk teki na tabemono to shite sekai de mo y.mei desu.
cards.japanese: 豆腐は、健康的な食べ物として世界でも有名です。

cards.english: Tofu is cheap and healthy.
cards.romaji: T fu wa yasukute kenk teki desu.
cards.japanese: 豆腐は安くて健康的です。

cards.english: Lately you can get taiyaki with a variety of different fillings.
cards.romaji: Saikin wa, taiyaki no nakami ni iroiro na shurui ga arimasu.
cards.japanese: 最近は、たい焼きの中身にいろいろな種類があります。

cards.english: Shizuoka is very famous for green tea.
cards.romaji: Shizuoka wa, ryokucha de y.mei desu.
cards.japanese: 静岡は、緑茶で有名です。

cards.english: Cut mochi is enjoyed either grilled or cooked.
cards.romaji: Kirimochi wa yaitari ry ri shitari shite tabemasu.
cards.japanese: 切り餅は焼いたり料理したりして食べます。

cards.english: There are glutinous rice-pounding events held locally in Japan on New Year's Day.
cards.romaji: O-sh gatsu ni wa, chiiki de mochitsuki taikai ga okonawaremasu.
cards.japanese: お正月には、地域で餅つき大会が行われます。

cards.english: In Japan, there are many people who eat natt. every morning.
cards.romaji: Nihon de wa, maiasa natt o taberu hito ga takusan imasu.
cards.japanese: 日本では、毎朝納豆を食べる人がたくさんいます。

cards.english: In Japan, there are many different types of iced coffee available at vending machines.
cards.romaji: Nihon de wa, iroiro na shurui no aisu k h. ga jid hanbaiki de kaemasu.
cards.japanese: 日本では、いろいろな種類のアイスコーヒーが自動販売機で買えます。

cards.english: Ramune is enjoyed typically in summer not only for its refreshing taste, but also for its refreshingly cool-looking glass bottle.
cards.romaji: Ramune wa, sawayaka na aji dake de naku, suzushige na garasubin no shiy mo atte, natsu ni yoku nomaremasu.
cards.japanese: ラムネは、爽やかな味だけでなく、涼しげなガラス瓶の仕様もあって、夏によく飲まれます。

cards.english: The alcohol content in ch.hai is rather low, but canned ch.hai can have an alcohol percentage as high as 9%.
cards.romaji: Ch.hai no aruk rudo wa hikume desu ga, kan ch.hai wa aruk rudo ga ky.-p.sento mo aru mono mo arimasu.
cards.japanese: チューハイのアルコール度は低めですが、缶チューハイはアルコール度が9パーセントもあるものもあります。

cards.english: Hamburger steak is one of the most popular dishes chosen by children in Japan.
cards.romaji: Hanb gu wa, Nihon no kodomo ga suki na tabemono no hitotsu desu.
cards.japanese: ハンバーグは、日本の子供が好きな食べ物の一つです。

cards.english: The taste of homemade miso soup differs from family to family.
cards.romaji: Tezukuri no miso shiru wa, katei ni yotte aji ga chigaimasu.
cards.japanese: 手作りの味噌汁は、家庭によって味が違います。

cards.english: Curry and rice is usually served on one plate, and consists of curry, white rice and special pickles called "fukushinzuke".
cards.romaji: Kar. raisu wa, hitotsu no o-sara ni gohan, kar., fukujinzuke o moritukemasu.
cards.japanese: カレーライスは、一つのお皿にご飯、カレー、福神漬けを盛り付けます。

cards.english: In winter, Japanese people enjoy hotpot dishes by sharing food in one big pot with family members.
cards.romaji: Fuyu wa, kazoku min'na de nabe o kakonde shokuji o tanoshimimasu.
cards.japanese: 冬は、家族みんなで鍋を囲んで食事を楽しみます。

cards.english: Japanese people eat sakuramochi on the 3rd of March -Girls' Day.
cards.romaji: Nihon-jin wa, sakuramochi o san-gatsu mikka Hinamatsuri no hi ni tabemasu.
cards.japanese: 日本人は、桜餅を三月三日ひな祭りの日に食べます。

cards.english: Ramune melts in the mouth like sugar.
cards.romaji: Ramune wa, sat no y ni kuchi de tokemasu.
cards.japanese: ラムネは、砂糖のように口で溶けます。

cards.english: Dumplings eaten at cherry-blossom viewings are coloured pink, white and green.
cards.romaji: Hanami dango wa pinku, shiro, midori no san-shoku desu.
cards.japanese: 花見団子はピンク、白、緑の三色です。

cards.english: Sweet bean jelly is very sweet, so it goes well with a bitter green tea called "matcha".
cards.romaji: Y kan wa, totemo amai no de nigai matcha to yoku aimasu.
cards.japanese: 羊羹は、とても甘いので苦い抹茶とよく合います。

cards.english: There are many different types of custard pudding in Japan: some are available at supermarkets, while others are posh desserts from famous patissiers.
cards.romaji: Nihon ni wa, s.p. de kaeru purin kara y.mei patishie no k ky. dez.to made, iroiro na taipu no purin ga arimasu.
cards.japanese: 日本には、スーパーで買えるプリンから有名パティシエの高級デザートまで、いろいろなタイプのプリンがあります。

cards.english: Apples from Aomori prefecture in season are sweet and very juicy.
cards.romaji: Aomori-ken no shun no ringo wa, amakute mizumizush desu.
cards.japanese: 青森県の旬のりんごは、甘くてみずみずしいです。

cards.english: Bitter Japanese persimmons become very sweet when they're dried.
cards.romaji: Shibugaki wa, hoshigaki ni suru to amaku narimasu.
cards.japanese: 渋柿は、干し柿にすると甘くなります。

cards.english: In Japan, cherries are one of the most expensive fruits.
cards.romaji: Nihon de wa, sakurambo wa ichi-ban takai kudamono no hitotsu desu.
cards.japanese: 日本では、さくらんぼは一番高い果物の一つです。

cards.english: Ehime and Wakayama prefectures are famous for their mandarin oranges.
cards.romaji: Ehime-ken to Wakayama-ken wa, mikan de y.mei desu.
cards.japanese: 愛媛県と和歌山県は、みかんで有名です。

cards.english: Many Japanese like eating cucumbers pickled with salt.
cards.romaji: Nihon-jin no ku wa ky.ri no tsukemono ga suki desu.
cards.japanese: 日本人の多くはきゅうりの漬物が好きです。

cards.english: Many children don't like green pepper in Japan due to its bitter taste.
cards.romaji: P.man wa nigai no de, p.man ga kirai na kodomo ga takusan imasu.
cards.japanese: ピーマンは苦いので、ピーマンが嫌いな子供がたくさんいます。

cards.english: Eating Japanese eggplants, particularly autumn eggplants, is said to lower body temperature.
cards.romaji: Nasubi no naka de mo, akinasu o taberu to taion o sageru to iwarete imasu.
cards.japanese: なすの中でも、秋なすを食べると体温を下げると言われています。

cards.english: Many Japanese people enjoy grilled or cooked ginkgo seeds.
cards.romaji: .kuno Nihon-jin ga, ich no tane de aru gin'nan o kononde tabemasu.
cards.japanese: 多くの日本人が、銀杏の種であるぎんなんを好んで食べます。

cards.english: Pickled plums are usually eaten with rice, and are also a typical ingredient for rice balls.
cards.romaji: umeboshi wa, ts j. raisu to issho ni taberare, onigiri no nakami to shitemo daihy.teki na zairy. desu.
cards.japanese: 梅干しは、通常ライスと一緒に食べられ、おにぎりの中身としても代表的な材料です。

cards.english: Since matcha powder melts easily, it's enjoyed in various ways, such as mixed into vanilla ice cream and in matcha pound cake.
cards.romaji: matcha no kona wa tokeyasui node, banira aisu to mazetari, matcha paundo k.ki ni shiy. shitari, iroirona h.h. de tanoshimemasu.
cards.japanese: 抹茶の粉は溶けやすいので、バニラアイスと混ぜたり、抹茶パウンドケーキに使用したり、色々な方法で楽しめます。

cards.english: A typical Japanese snack is senbei and green tea.
cards.romaji: nihon no tenkeiteki na sunakku wa, senbei to ryokucha desu.
cards.japanese: 日本の典型的なスナックは、せんべいと緑茶です。
